description:
The heroine, Tsukiko, enrolled to a school that was recently changed from all-boys school to co-ed. Since the area where the school is conveniently rural and the rather exclusive curriculums the school has, up until now the heroine is the only one female who enrolled to the school.

In Starry Sky, the 13 constellations of the Zodiac are personified into handsome young men. The anime will be directed by Kiyomo Sayaka who worked with Vampire Knight. Similar to Hetalia - Axis Powers, Starry Sky's anime will be distributed through the Animate.tv website and other means.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

name.native: ラウル・マティアス・ジャン・エーメ

node.description:
__Height:__ 174 cm (5'8'') 

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/kenichi_suzumura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzu__kensan)

His favorite animals are dogs, and he has two dogs named Ivy and Momo. His favorite foods are curry and Pino ice cream. He enjoys cooking and playing video games. He can speak in the Kansai-ben dialect. He has a younger brother, Masaki, and an older sister, Shizuka. He has practiced aikido.  

He left Artvision in 2012 and has found his own talent agency INTENTION. He is part of the voice actor unit STA☆MEN, alongside Junichi Suwabe, Daisuke Kishio, Hiroki Takahashi, Hiroyuki Yoshino, Makoto Yasumura, and Kousuke Toriumi. They performed the ending theme for the Tokusatsu drama "Go Busters" of the Super Sentai Series and released it as their third single. He's also part of CONNECT, first unit of Kiramune, with Mitsuo Iwata. They released three mini-albums and a single. As a solo artist, he has released 13 singles, 3 albums and 2 mini-albums.  

Married frequent costar [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) on August 8, 2011.

__Height:__ 173 cm
__Skills & Abilities:__ Kendo

[Profile (Pony Canyon)](https://www.ponycanyon.co.jp/artist/31356600) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/black_fukuyama)

Fukuyama released his debut music album "Romantic World 31" on his birthday (November 26) in 2009, his second album "Love Letters 2: Paris Romantic" on July 21, 2010, his third album "Fukuyama Jun, Ai wo Utau!" on May 25, 2011, and his fourth album "Love Letter 3 ~Matsuri no Kuni de~" on May 22, 2013. He also appeared in a 2009 romantic comedy movie Fujoshi Kanojo in a cameo role.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Joker](https://anilist.co/character/121590/Ren-Amamiya) - Persona 5
- Renya Goutou - 13 Sentinels: Aegis Rim
- [Camu](https://anilist.co/character/278324/Camu) - Punishing: Gray Raven
- [Kamui](https://anilist.co/character/259960) - Punishing: Gray Raven
- Vyn Richter - Tears of Themis
- Martin - Rune Factory 5
- Hugo - Zenless Zone Zero
- Logos - Arknights

**Favorite Cartoon Character:** Snoopy
**Favorite Food:** Omelet, Stew 
**Hobbies:** Collecting Nike running shoes, Video games 
**Skills & Abilities:** Saxophone

__[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/midorikawa-hikaru.html) | [Blog](http://hikaru23.hatenablog.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/greenriver_sr) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%B7%91%E5%B7%9D%E5%85%89)__

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Mirror Knight - Ultraman Zero (Ultraman)
- Wisure - Kishiryu Sentai Ryusolger (Super Sentai)

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirumodake)

After graduating from an animation school she was working on many productions for Yumeta Company and Studio Deen.

Married to [Tetsuya Yanagisawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109785/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sna72860) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村誠_(脚本家%29)

Affiliated with [Frontier Works](https://anilist.co/studio/61/).

Initially he was mainly a scriptwriter for radio programs, but ever since his involvement on [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/144/) in 2002, he has been working on animation-related projects as both scriptwriter and producer.

In 2010, he made his directorial debut with the puppet animation [Cheburashka](https://anilist.co/anime/9340/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [either](https://anilist.co/staff/134789/) of [the two](https://anilist.co/staff/265458/) animators._
Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).
